data.name: The Mystery Function
data.description:
# Task
There is a function called `mystery()` which takes a string and returns a new string. It is called like this:
```python
mystery('Hello world')
```
*Note - strings only consist of characters from the Latin/English alphabet and spaces.*

Your task is to try and figure out what exactly this function does, and then replicate it by defining `solved()`.

You can run several tests by writing lines of code like the following in the Sample Tests Fixture.
```python
# to check what the mystery function will return:
print(mystery('Hello world'))

# to test your code against the mystery function:
test.assert_equals(solved('Hello world'),mystery('Hello world'))
```

*Note - Remember to remove all comments containing the word 'mystery', or the code will not pass the test suite.*
